ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, take this class with Mme Koundi. There is a fair amount busy work but it is not that hard and there are no real surprise questions on the tests: it is all material you should be familiar with.

This class does exactly what it says on the tin: it's Level 3 French. I was frustrated a lot with the class because it uses a lot of really interesting material (Jules et Jim, L'etranger) but never really does justice to any of it; we spent most of the time discussing what happened on a surface level in each assigned reading rather than actually going into any depth on the significance of what we were discussing. There was a lot of work and you have to do all of it if you want to keep up. You might not have a way around this, and it wasn't enough to make me want to stop French, but it could have been so much more and I can't say I'm coming away from it having had a fantastic experience.

This class is a review of most of the tenses and the typical grammatical rules. I think almost everyone taking this class is taking it because they have to, not because they want to be French majors.It was a lot of work. I'm okay with a lot of homework if I learn a lot in the process, but I don't think my French improved enough for 2-3 hours of work per night to be worth it.
it is a very enjoyable course even thought it meets everyday, if you have the right professor and Soumia Koundi was a great one. I recommend it without reservations.

I would recommend taking French L3 to another student to fill a requirement with Mme. Koundi. The course is straight-forward and you do improve your french quite a bit. It is some work but it is worth it to improve your language skills. Otherwise you will not get any better at French.
